form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: Q & A Statement of Wong, Ramon Fong So ng, A17 984 698

full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/21/2023 Q & A Statement of Wong, Ramon Fong So ng 1-8-69 A17 984 698 Q When were you admitted to the United States? A I entered at Calexico on April 2, 1968. BY ATTORNEY LEE: (to Mr. Wong) Q Where do you live now in the United States? A My Los Angeles address is 855 Cleveland Street. I also reside in Moniclin Calexico in the restaurant, my brother and I are the partners. When he became ill upon my arrival in the United States I had to go back to Calexico to assist in running the restaurant and he passed away and I am still trying to clear the restaurant matter in Calexico. BY INVESTIGATOR GUID: Q Since your entry into the United States on April 2, 1968 where have you been employed? A I only work two weeks for substituting for my friend only in Los Angeles. Q Where in Los Angeles? A Far East Terrace, Lankershim Boulevard, North Hollywood. Q In what capacity were you employed at the Far East Terrace? A As a cook. Q Did you ever go to work for Mr. Loo at the Holly Cafe? A No. Q Did you ever visit Mr. Loo at the Holly Cafe? A Yes. Q When did you visit Mr. Loo at the Holly Cafe? A Last year. Q When? A Shortly after my arrival I went to visit him. Q Well inasmuch as Mr. Loo applied for your visa for you to enter the United States and signed a Form I-575 to work for him, why did you not report for employment in his cafe in El Centro? A Because I intended at that time to apply for a petition for my wife to come to the United States that is why I haven't the time. Q I can't see any connection for why you didn't go to work and your intention to apply for a petition for your wife. BY ATTORNEY LEE: He reported to Mr. Loo at the time when he came to the United States, but while he was there he informed Mr. Loo he wanted to come to Los - 5 -
